title: Conflict and Argument Idioms
content: Complete the idioms and phrases related to conflict and arguments by filling in the missing words.

questions.instructions: Complete the idiom by filling in the missing word.
questions.question: 1. A [field 1] of wills - A disagreement where both sides are determined to win
questions.correct_feedback: Excellent! You got this idiom correct.

questions.instructions: Complete the idiom by filling in the missing word.
questions.question: 2. Get off (someone's) [field 1] - Stop criticising or telling someone what to do
questions.correct_feedback: Excellent! You got this idiom correct.

questions.instructions: Complete the idiom by filling in the missing word.
questions.question: 3. Bury the [field 1] - To stop an argument and agree to make peace
questions.correct_feedback: Excellent! You got this idiom correct.

questions.instructions: Complete the idiom by filling in the missing word.
questions.question: 4. Send (someone) [field 1] - To tell someone to leave
questions.correct_feedback: Excellent! You got this idiom correct.

questions.instructions: Complete the idiom by filling in the missing word.
questions.question: 5. Wipe the [field 1] clean (very similar to 'bury the hatchet') - To forget about previous disagreements or problems and to start again
questions.correct_feedback: Excellent! You got this idiom correct.

questions.instructions: Complete the idiom by filling in the missing word.
questions.question: 6. [field 1] on thin ice - Doing or saying something that could easily/quickly end up in a disagreement or trouble
questions.correct_feedback: Excellent! You got this idiom correct.

questions.instructions: Complete the idiom by filling in the missing word.
questions.question: 7. Pick [field 1] in (something) - Trying to find faults in something someone is doing or saying
questions.correct_feedback: Excellent! You got this idiom correct.

questions.instructions: Complete the idiom by filling in the missing word.
questions.question: 8. An [field 1] branch - Something you do, say or offer to try and end a disagreement
questions.correct_feedback: Excellent! You got this idiom correct.

questions.instructions: Complete the idiom by filling in the missing word.
questions.question: 9. Add [field 1] to the fire - To make a situation or argument even worse
questions.correct_feedback: Excellent! You got this idiom correct.

questions.instructions: Complete the idiom by filling in the missing word.
questions.question: 10. At each other's [field 1] - Always arguing (normally strongly)
questions.correct_feedback: Excellent! You got this idiom correct.
questions.incorrect_feedback: The correct answer is: throats (or throat)
questions.no_answer_feedback: The correct answer is: throats (or throat)

questions.instructions: Complete the idiom by filling in the missing word.
questions.question: 11. A [field 1] point - A subject that someone is sensitive about and should therefore be avoided
questions.correct_feedback: Excellent! You got this idiom correct.

questions.instructions: Complete the idiom by filling in the missing word.
questions.question: 12. A [field 1] battle - A disagreement that has been going on for some time
questions.correct_feedback: Excellent! You got this idiom correct.
